txt.en: 'Do not let your mind dwell there long, Lady Hildith.'
'I have served your husband and his father before him as counsellor in Grimslade.'
'Never has Grimslade faced such dire times. Never has Rohan been so threatened.'
'You are leading as Grimbold would, brave and just.'
Dunward
'Perhaps your words were once too harsh, but you are a worthy Thane now.'
'Go, half-orc. You are free! Call off your soldiers and fire, and go where you will.'
'It may be so, Dunward, but I cannot take back my last words to my husband.'
'If he lives, he is abandoned and alone. It is my fault.'
'Thank you! I swear I will repay your kindness.'
'Are you ready, boys? Kill them!'
'No!'
'I said, kill them!'
'We will slaughter the weak like lambs, and burn their homes to ashes!'
'Gaah!'
'I do not regret my mercy, nor my hope that you would be true to your word.'
'You will be haunted forever by your broken oath, half-orc.'
'This waiting is most unnerving....'
'I find myself reflecting upon my regrets.'
'What in the world...?'
'We were on our way to Edoras as Gandalf bid, and we heard a commotion. I hoped we were not too late!'
'We...we lost four good men, and we would have soon been overrun....'
'I have wronged your husband, lady Hildith, but I hope this rights things between myself and Grimbold.'
'His wife has wounded him worst of all, I fear.'
'I cursed him for leaving me on the eve of battle...and told him I never wanted to lay eyes on him again.'
Soldier
